page.title: 08Maltby
page.content: The outlying estates to the North of the small mining town of Maltby are included in our survey.Within this area of housing a number of flats and with flat roofs are prominent. This development was built in 1941 to house people who came to work at the Royal Ordnance Factory in Maltby.A clue to the war-time origin of the area is 'Churchill Avenue'. Semi-detached and four-house terraces followed after the war and the area has finally been built up over the last 10 years with modern bungalows, semi and fully detached houses. Building is continuing today as work has just started on 31 flats adjacent to the greenland plantation just off Braithwell Road. This area is served by a number of shops, three public houses, a garden centre and a filling station.
